<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>15</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 779, 91]]<|/det|>
Which statement describes what happens to air particles when the air is heated?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 100, 133, 118]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 100, 420, 118]]<|/det|>
The particles move more slowly.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 125, 133, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 125, 425, 144]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 152, 133, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 152, 443, 170]]<|/det|>
The particles move closer together.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 178, 133, 196]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 178, 378, 196]]<|/det|>

<label>16</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 222, 603, 241]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 250, 133, 268]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 250, 668, 268]]<|/det|>
The mass of the liquid increases, making the liquid less dense.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 277, 133, 295]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 277, 678, 295]]<|/det|>
The mass of the liquid increases, making the liquid more dense.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 304, 133, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 304, 685, 322]]<|/det|>
The volume of the liquid increases, making the liquid less dense.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 330, 133, 349]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 330, 692, 349]]<|/det|>
The volume of the liquid increases, making the liquid more dense.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 454, 133, 472]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 304, 107, 322]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 303, 920, 337]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a bar magnet at rest on a smooth horizontal surface. A length of soft-iron wire is held parallel to the magnet. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[297, 345, 698, 479]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 491, 291, 509]]<|/det|> The wire is released. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 522, 250, 540]]<|/det|> What happens? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 551, 134, 568]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 551, 480, 568]]<|/det|> The wire moves away from the magnet. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 577, 131, 596]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 577, 458, 596]]<|/det|> The wire moves towards the magnet. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 605, 131, 623]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 604, 920, 636]]<|/det|> The wire's centre stays in its present position and the wire rotates through \(90^{\circ}\) in a clockwise direction. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 645, 133, 663]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 645, 920, 677]]<|/det|> The wire's centre stays in its present position and the wire rotates through \(90^{\circ}\) in an anticlockwise direction. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 705, 104, 723]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 704, 848, 722]]<|/det|> A man walks across a carpet. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>30</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 702, 91]]<|/det|>
The current in a kettle is 10 A and the kettle is protected by a 13 A fuse.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 625, 120]]<|/det|>
The owner of the kettle replaces the 13 A fuse with a 3 A fuse.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 504, 151]]<|/det|>
What happens when the kettle is switched on?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 161, 134, 179]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 160, 556, 179]]<|/det|>
The fuse melts and the kettle might be damaged.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 188, 134, 206]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 188, 520, 205]]<|/det|>
The fuse melts and the kettle is undamaged.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 214, 134, 232]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 214, 594, 231]]<|/det|>
The fuse does not melt and the kettle works correctly.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 240, 134, 258]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 240, 562, 257]]<|/det|>
The fuse does not melt but the kettle fails to work.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 621, 552, 638]]<|/det|>
2 and 3

<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 621, 710, 638]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 107, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 675, 89]]<|/det|> In an experiment, a wire is held above a compass needle as shown. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[295, 100, 700, 225]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 235, 792, 252]]<|/det|> An electric current is switched on in the wire and the compass needle is deflected. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 265, 920, 298]]<|/det|> Which row explains why this happens and then describes what happens when the current is reversed? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 311, 690, 517]]<|/det|>
why this happenswhat happens when the current is reversed
Athere is a magnetic field inside the wirethe compass needle deflects in the opposite direction
Bthere is a magnetic field inside the wirethe compass needle remains deflected in the same direction
Cthere is a magnetic field around the wirethe compass needle deflects in the opposite direction
Dthere is a magnetic field around the wirethe compass needle remains deflected in the same direction

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>34</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 445, 89]]<|/det|>
A rechargeable battery contains lithium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 101, 458, 119]]<|/det|>
The lithium exists as positive lithium ions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 131, 589, 149]]<|/det|>
How does an ion of lithium differ from an atom of lithium?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 160, 134, 178]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 160, 554, 178]]<|/det|>
The ion has fewer electrons orbiting the nucleus.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 187, 133, 205]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 186, 552, 205]]<|/det|>
The ion has more electrons orbiting the nucleus.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 214, 133, 232]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 214, 477, 231]]<|/det|>
The nucleus of the ion has less charge.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 240, 133, 257]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 240, 562, 257]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 284, 106, 301]]<|/det|>
<label>35</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 282, 549, 301]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 414, 448, 432]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 440, 435, 458]]<|/det|>
3 The proton number is 26.

<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 470, 220, 488]]<|/det|>
1 and 2

<label>D</label>

plants and other living things

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 710, 735, 728]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 423, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 131, 133, 148]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 158, 233, 175]]<|/det|>
hydrogen

<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 184, 215, 201]]<|/det|>
oxygen

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 210, 133, 227]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 253, 767, 272]]<|/det|>
The nearest star to the Sun is Proxima Centauri at a distance of 4.2 light years.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 284, 371, 301]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 314, 808, 332]]<|/det|>
1 Telescope images of Proxima Centauri show it as it was 4.2 years ago.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 339, 920, 373]]<|/det|>
2 If a spacecraft near Proxima Centauri sent a radio message to the Earth, it would take 4.2 years to arrive.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 380, 638, 398]]<|/det|>
3 Proxima Centauri is outside the Milky Way galaxy.
